The diagnosis is clinical:

o progressive increase in symptoms lasting at least two days and requiring a change in treatment

o not soothed by rapid-acting bronchodilators used frequently and in large quantities

o without returning to the usual state

question.title: What is a characteristic of an asthma exacerbation?
question.description: A multiple-choice question about asthma exacerbations

option_a.title: Symptoms that resolve quickly with treatment
option_a.description: An incorrect option that might be plausible

option_b.title: A sudden worsening of symptoms without a return to normal
option_b.description: A plausible option that might be confusing

option_c.title: Symptoms that improve with frequent use of bronchodilators
option_c.description: An incorrect option that might be related to the question

option_d.title: A persistent increase in symptoms lasting at least two days
option_d.description: The correct option that requires careful consideration
